result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Filson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J Filson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew J Filson was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Matthew J Filson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided.
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Perform 40 hours of community  service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Filson

Prior: 6607 24th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 2 and 3 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentences withheld, placed on probation for one year w/conditions.  Cash bond to apply to costs; any balance to be returned to poster.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Matthew J Filson, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Johnson states parties have reached a hold open agreement and requests an adjournment to go over conditions of agreement with DE; no objection by the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 09:20 am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Defendant, Matthew J Filson, appeared with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.   Clerk: PT
Atty Johnson requests a 6 week adjournment to follow up on discovery with Joint Services; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:50 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.  Bound over to Br. 8.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 9/10/15 at 8:50.  Bond continued.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.
